hints.content:
The number line shows $\maroonD{4}$ equal jumps of $\blueD{8}$ units.

![The same number line with each arrow labeled, plus 8](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0cbe04ad606ea1d7434c17a6205c0650d4218d64)

options.explanation:
$\maroonD{4}\times\blueD{8}=\maroonD{4}\blueD{\text{ eights}}$.

That's the same as $\maroonD{2}\blueD{\text{ eights}}+\maroonD{2}\blueD{\text{ eights}}$.

![The same number line with a brace spanning the first 2 arrows labeled, 2 eights, and a brace spanning the other 2 arrows labeled, 2 eights](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/9fd2754783c7a97724efaa9bb48c40944eab8e1e)

$\redD{16}+\purpleC{16}=\greenD{32}$

So $\maroonD{4}\times\blueD{8}=\greenD{32}$.

question.content:
**Multiply.**  
*Hint: Use the number line below to help solve the equation.* 

$4 \times 8 = $ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]
